leaders.bg: Sutton Funding operates from Madison Avenue in NYC, offering AI-powered lending approvals up to $2M. The company provides merchant cash advances, term loans, lines of credit, and equipment financing using proprietary AI technology for fast approval decisions. Limited public information available on individual leadership.

Serial entrepreneur who started career on the Chicago Board Options Exchange in 1993. Built a retail dry cleaning and garment restoration business grossing nearly $10M/year. Founded Rapid Capital Funding in 2007, grew it, and sold it. Acquired a stake in Bitty Advance in early 2020, then purchased full ownership months later. Under his leadership, Bitty committed capital to fund up to $10M/month. OppFi acquired 35% equity stake in Aug 2024 for $15.25M cash plus $2.7M in stock, with options to acquire majority by 2027 and total ownership by 2030.

news.h: OppFi: 'Bitty is a Great Partner'
news.d: During Q3 2025 earnings, OppFi CEO Todd Schwartz praised Bitty's growth, noting significant additional growth opportunities and ongoing supply-demand imbalance in small business revenue-based finance.

news.h: OppFi Acquires 35% Equity Interest in Bitty Advance
news.d: OppFi acquired 35% stake in Bitty for $15.25M cash and $2.7M stock, entering the small business financing market with options for majority ownership by 2027.

news.h: Bitty Advance Funded 29,000+ Small Businesses Since 2020
news.d: Under Craig Hecker's ownership, Bitty has facilitated funding to over 29,000 small businesses with products ranging from $2,000 to $250,000.

leaders.bg: Founded Fundomate Technologies in 2016, building the first automated search engine platform specifically designed for MCA industry. Attended Santa Monica College. Previously CEO at FundersCloud.com and held positions at Heights Marketing Inc. Fundomate is headquartered in El Segundo, CA and partners with ISOs and merchant-level salespeople to provide short-term capital to small and midsize merchants who cannot qualify for traditional bank loans.

QuickSpark was founded in 2010 in Phoenix, AZ and acquired by TimePayment in 2022. TimePayment is a Boston-based fintech owned by affiliates of Fortress Investment Group. QuickSpark works with over 3,500 vendors, including 500 with deep e-commerce integrations, funding equipment purchases as low as $1,000 with 12-60 month terms across 50+ industries.

news.h: TimePayment Announces Acquisition of QuickSpark Financial
news.d: TimePayment acquired QuickSpark, an e-commerce focused equipment financing company, to operate as a strategic business unit serving 50+ industries.

leaders.bg: Co-founded Braavo in 2015 to provide non-dilutive financing for mobile app businesses. Previously served as COO at Updater and VP/Director at Square 1 Bank, where he directed the bank's national early-stage practice, Square Roots. Introduced to co-founder Sergei Kovalenko through a shared NYC startup connection. Under his leadership, Braavo has deployed over $2 billion in equity-free financing to 8,000+ apps worldwide across North America and Europe.

Serial entrepreneur with 15 years in IT and software/product development. Co-founded Braavo Capital in 2014-2015 with Mark Loranger. Also founded Aprenita and iTechArt (now Vention). Active as investor and mentor. Braavo Growth Ventures (BGV) reached profitability in 2025 under his technical leadership.

news.h: Braavo Capital Celebrates 10 Years, $2 Billion in Financing Deployed
news.d: Braavo celebrated a decade of providing equity-free financing, surpassing $2B deployed to 8,000+ apps worldwide. BGV also reached profitability.

news.h: Braavo Capital Bags $5M to Accelerate Growth in Subscription App Market
news.d: Braavo raised its Series B to invest in web2app growth and deepen partnerships with founders via Braavo Growth Ventures.

leaders.bg: Gemini Business Funding was established in 2017 in Clearwater, Florida at 2963 Gulf To Bay Blvd. The company claims a 90% approval rate using proprietary underwriting technology with same-day decisions. Offers revenue-based financing with no fixed monthly payments and a simple 1-page application requiring only 4 months of bank statements. Limited public information on individual leadership.

Co-founded SG Credit Partners in 2018 by spinning out the cash flow and technology lending division from Super G Capital. Previously CFO at Super G Capital. Co-founded Bluefin Payment Systems in 2007. 20+ years in tech and finance investing. Member of SGCP's Investment Committee and Board of Directors. In July 2025, secured an $80M term loan, $34M delayed draw facility, and $12M equity investment from Kayne Anderson BDC. SGCP has invested in 200+ companies, originating $1B+ in commitments across Commercial Finance, Consumer Products, and Software & Technology.

Co-founded SG Credit Partners with Marc Cole. Joined Super G Capital in 2014 to start its cash flow lending division, which they spun out as SGCP in 2018. Previously co-founded Intermix Capital Partners, an investment and advisory firm for SMBs. Began career at Oppenheimer & Co. (acquired by CIBC World Markets) in the Media Investment Banking Group. Regular contributor to American Banker and ABL Advisor publications.

news.h: Kayne Anderson BDC Announces $126M Investment in SG Credit Partners
news.d: Kayne Anderson structured an $80M term loan, $34M delayed draw facility, and $12M common equity investment to support SGCP's growth in lower middle market lending.

news.h: SG Credit Partners Continues to Evolve from Cash Flow Lending Origins
news.d: SGCP evolved from its Super G Capital origins into a leading lower middle market credit platform across three lending verticals with $350M+ deployed.

leaders.bg: Co-founded Wingspire Capital in 2019 to provide senior secured ABL solutions to middle-market businesses. Holds a JD from Duke University School of Law. Under his leadership, Wingspire delivered record-setting 2025 performance, doubling total fundings year-over-year and closing the year with $3B in capital commitments and $1.6B in loans outstanding. Wingspire is backed by Blue Owl Capital Corporation (NYSE: OBDC), a $295B AUM global alternative asset manager.

Founded Liberty Commercial Finance in 2017, growing it to $1.3B+ in total equipment finance volume before it was acquired by Wingspire Capital in June 2022. Liberty rebranded as Wingspire Equipment Finance, headquartered in Tustin, CA. Equipment Finance closed a record $701M in 2025. Wingspire Equipment Finance focuses on transactions from $1M to $50M for middle market companies across numerous industries.

news.h: Wingspire Equipment Finance Closes Record 2025, Surpassing $700M
news.d: Wingspire Equipment Finance closed a record $701M in 2025, expanding HQ, tech, and lending reach.

news.h: Wingspire Capital Announces $3B in Capital Commitments and $1.6B AUM
news.d: Entering 2026, Wingspire doubled total fundings in 2025 compared to prior year, with a strong pipeline and increased lending capacity.

news.h: Wingspire Capital Provides $45M to Leading Dental Services Organization
news.d: Latest deal demonstrates Wingspire's continued momentum providing large senior secured facilities across diverse industries.

news.h: Wingspire Capital Upsizes Revolver to $300M for APR Energy
news.d: Wingspire upsized a revolving credit facility to $300M for APR Energy, supporting the energy company's growth plans.

leaders.bg: Invested in and became CEO of The Business Backer in 2009. Grew the company from 5 to over 100 employees and generated 30x revenue growth, leading to an 8-figure exit to Enova International (NYSE: ENVA) in 2015. Left Business Backer/Enova in 2018 to pursue CEO coaching. Now Board Chair of EasterSeals Greater Cincinnati, founding board member of Team Gleason, and Chairman/Co-founder of Quanta HCM. Active in Entrepreneurs Organization (EO).

Born entrepreneur who developed first commercial software product at age 15. Former owner of Ascent Solutions, an Inc 500 software company known for products like PKZIP and WinZip. Co-founded The Business Backer in 2006 with Mark Deeter. Grew company to 80+ employees and nearly $20M revenue in 2014, earning Inc. 5000 rankings four years running. Assets sold to Enova International in 2015. Active member of Queen City Angels investment group in Cincinnati.

news.h: Enova to Acquire Grasshopper Bank for $369M
news.d: Enova, parent of Business Backer, announced acquisition of Grasshopper Bancorp for $369M in cash and stock, expected to close H2 2026. Steve Cunningham became Enova CEO Jan 2026.

news.h: Enova's Small Business Portfolio Includes 7 Brands
news.d: Business Backer is part of Enova's portfolio alongside OnDeck, Headway Capital, CashNetUSA, NetCredit, Simplic, and Pangea, serving 13M+ customers.

leaders.bg: CEO of TrustFi, leading operations connecting businesses with a network of 50+ vetted lending partners. TrustFi has facilitated over $500 million in funding. Also listed as CEO of LendFi Global on some profiles. Limited additional public information available on personal background.

President of TrustFi with background in architecture and finance. Brings a unique cross-disciplinary perspective to TrustFi's lending platform operations. Limited additional public information available.

Registered agent and financial manager at QFS Capital. Oversees operations from Fort Lauderdale office. QFS Capital was founded in 2019 on principles of quality, transparent funding for small businesses, specializing in reverse consolidation and cash flow relief with a streamlined electronic process.
Key decision maker in QFS Capital's lending and business development operations. Limited public information available on personal background.

Former CEO of BCI Capital Corp and President of CIT Asset Finance, where he oversaw large-ticket asset-backed commercial finance platforms including capital equipment finance, commercial aviation, maritime, logistics, and franchise finance. Led the transition of the BCI Capital team and platform to Ansley Park Capital when it launched in January 2024 with Ares Management backing. Ansley Park closed a landmark $400M inaugural ABS deal in Nov 2025, the largest first-time issuance in large-ticket equipment finance.

Over 40 years in banking and equipment finance. Former CIO at BciCapital. Previously co-head of Wachovia (now Wells Fargo) equipment finance platform. Held leadership positions at CIT Capital Equipment Finance and GE Capital. Named to Monitor's Most Influential People in Equipment Finance. Oversees all aspects of operations, underwriting, portfolio/asset management, structuring and marketing at Ansley Park.

Over 30 years in financial services. Former Managing Director of CIT Capital Equipment Finance, leading provider of large-ticket ($3M+) commercial equipment finance. Former Chief Commercial Officer at BciCapital. Transitioned from EVP of Originations to EVP, Head of Capital Markets at Ansley Park. Specializes in equipment finance, asset-based lending, and leveraged finance.

news.h: Ansley Park Capital Closes $400M Inaugural Asset-Backed Securitization
news.d: Largest first-time issuance in large-ticket equipment finance market, with Moody's providing ratings across the full capital stack.

news.h: Ares Commercial Finance and Ansley Park Provide Financing to Shimmick Corporation
news.d: Ares provided a $15M revolving line of credit while Ansley Park provided a complementary $15M machinery and equipment term loan.

news.h: Ares Management Launches Ansley Park Capital
news.d: Ares entered the equipment finance market by launching Ansley Park Capital with the former BCI Capital executive team and integrated operating platform.

leaders.bg: Founded LeasePoint in 2016, growing it from a small-ticket broker to a national equipment finance platform with $180M+ in financial solutions deployed. Texas A&M BBA graduate. Former Partner at 4 Point Capital Advisors. Inc. 5000 honoree and NextGen 40 Under 40. Secured $40M incremental funding from Altriarch Asset Management in Oct 2024. Made significant executive team additions in 2024 while continuing to develop proprietary origination platform.

10+ years of operations and leadership experience across banking, heavy industry, consumer services, and technology. Former global commercial credit operations leader at General Electric, managing large international teams. Held executive roles at Spruce, Degreed, and GE. At LeasePoint, oversees core operations, people operations, product management, and sales support. Also active in climate advocacy, participating in the Climate Action Young Leaders Summit 2024.

news.h: LeasePoint Secures $40 Million Incremental Funding
news.d: LeasePoint secured $40M from Altriarch Asset Management to support rapid expansion in equipment financing and meet increasing demand from device manufacturers.

leaders.bg: Former founding partner at Shield Re-insurance Ltd. Bachelor of Business Administration from SUNY Albany. Launched Broadway Advance in 2014 as a full-service MCA broker and financial firm. Broadway Advance reported approximately $6M annual revenue in 2025 with 25 employees, working with 25+ funding companies and syndicate partners to provide MCAs up to $2M and term loans up to $5M.

Founded nFusion Capital in 2018. Former EVP at Far West Capital, grew it from small regional practice to national leader in factoring and ABL. Co-founded Mirabella Estates (sold to Exclusive Resorts in 11 months). Former CFO of Mall.com, raised $7.5M. Started career at Arthur Andersen consulting Fortune 500 companies. In 2025, grew portfolio by 50%+. Increased Synovus Bank credit facility to $125M (up from $75M) in April 2025, with TAB Bank and Zions Bank as co-lenders. Father of three children: Alec, Isabella, and Jaxon.

news.h: nFusion Capital Increases Synovus Bank Credit Facility to $125 Million
news.d: nFusion Capital closed a $125M credit facility with Synovus Bank, TAB Bank, and Zions Bank as co-lenders, having grown portfolio nearly 100% since initial facility in mid-2024.

news.h: 2025: Scaling Ever Higher
news.d: nFusion delivered exceptional 2025 results, growing portfolio by over 50% with record performance in factoring and ABL.

news.h: nFusion Capital Fuels Rapid Growth with $6M ABL Facility
news.d: Provided $6M asset-based lending facility to support a client's rapid growth and expansion plans.

leaders.bg: CEO of Select Funding since 2014, based in Calabasas/Burbank, California. Select Funding reported approximately $15.3M in annual revenue in 2025. The company was founded in 2009 by leasing industry veterans, providing working capital and equipment financing up to $1M for small businesses with 24-hour decisioning. Covers diverse equipment types including auto repair, beauty/salon, construction, manufacturing, HVAC, and restaurant equipment.

Leads Amerifi Capital as principal with 15+ aggregate years of experience in finance and business lending. Founded Amerifi Capital in 2018 as a direct funder focused on real underwriting. Company offers working capital up to $8M based on revenue performance with 24-hour funding capability. Contact: amit@amerificapital.com. Limited additional public information available on personal background.

12+ years as a licensed general contractor with deep understanding of construction industry financial challenges. Holds a PhD in Innovation Management from Cranfield School of Management. Co-founded and exited cybersecurity company NoPassword. Co-founded BlueTape in 2020 to solve payment and financing issues in the construction industry. Raised $55M ($50M debt from Arcadia Funds, $5M seed from Chicago Ventures) in 2022.

MIT undergrad (Mathematics/Computer Science), Wharton MBA (Finance/Strategic Management). Held senior roles at Wells Fargo, JP Morgan, Goldman Sachs, Charles Schwab, and Visa. Helped found LendingClub and led its investor side. Head of lending at Uplift, helping establish the digital lending industry. Named Top 100 MIT Alumni by Alumni Spotlight. Co-founded BlueTape in 2020 with Masoudnia.

news.h: BlueTape Raises $55M for Construction Industry SMBs
news.d: BlueTape raised $55M in debt and equity to transform financing and payments for SMBs in the construction industry with its BNPL platform for building materials.

leaders.bg: Founded GFE in 2014 with partner Viacheslav 'Steve' Eliyayev. Previously worked in real estate before discovering MCA industry. A cautious investor, he researched the MCA model extensively before committing. Built GFE into a recognized leader, securing a senior debt facility of up to $100M and funding over $400M in capital to small businesses since inception. Featured in deBanked and other industry publications.

Joined GFE as COO in 2019 after 20 years as a traditional banking executive. Former Executive Director at JPMorgan Chase, overseeing cybersecurity and technology controls. Expert in Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC). At GFE, established a best-in-class MCA Operational Resilience framework. 30-year friendship with co-founder Musheyev. Also serves as Chief Information Security Officer.

news.h: Experts: How GFE Went Big
news.d: Profile of GFE's growth from startup to a $100M facility, detailing how Musheyev and Shakhmurov built the company into a recognized alternative funding leader.

leaders.bg: Co-founded Katapult (NASDAQ: KPLT), the leading non-prime BNPL platform for omnichannel retail. Cornell Johnson MBA. Started with a retail coffee shop in Seattle, then ran a residential mortgage brokerage before co-founding Katapult. Met co-founder Luis Scull at ERA accelerator in 2017, launched Tongo in 2020. Tongo now has 40%+ of real estate agents nationwide on its platform with partnerships with Douglas Elliman and RE/MAX.

Founded Payfully in 2016, a cash advance platform for Airbnb hosts. First employee at Open Field Capital, helped grow AUM to $300M over a decade. Started career analyzing emerging tech companies at Amerindo Investment Advisors. Reconnected with Brandon Wright in 2020 to launch Tongo, applying the commission advance model to real estate agents. Born in Venezuela.
hooks: Grew Open Field Capital to $300M AUM

leaders.bg: 20-year product leader at Microsoft. Most recently Principal Program Manager for Microsoft 365 for SMB & M365 Lighthouse (2013-2022). Previously Senior Director, Developer Audience (Microsoft UK, 2011-2013) and Senior Product Manager (from 2002). MBA from University of North Carolina, BA from Emory University in English. Joined Tongo in Oct 2022. Featured in Authority Magazine as a Women Leader of Real Estate in 2025.

news.h: Tongo Named HousingWire Tech100 Winner 2025
news.d: Tongo recognized as top real estate technology company for its Financial Benefits Platform serving commission-based real estate professionals.

news.h: Tongo Announces Preferred Rates for Agents Affiliated with Anywhere
news.d: Tongo partnered with Anywhere Real Estate to offer preferred commission advance rates for agents at brokerages owned or franchised by Anywhere brands.

news.h: Tongo Grew Customer Base 179% in 2024
news.d: Tongo's commission advance and Financial Benefits Platform for real estate agents saw 179% customer base growth in 2024.

leaders.bg: CEO of TVT Capital since its founding in 2008. Pioneer in bridge loans for small and mid-sized businesses, providing funding from $100K to $25M across all 50 states. TVT Capital has expanded from bridge loans to include acquisition financing, merchant cash advances, equipment financing, and commercial real estate loans with flexible 3-24 month terms. Management team includes General Counsel Brody Valerga.
Principal at TVT Capital. Long-standing figure in the MCA and alternative lending space. Limited additional public information available on personal background.

Founded Quick Bridge Funding, a short-term working capital provider for SMBs. Quick Bridge was acquired by National Funding, where Gold remained as President. In 2020, became CEO and co-founded Good Funding with Jason Osiecki. Good Funding closed a $20M senior revolving credit facility with accordion to $30M in May 2021, its inaugural institutional financing. Company ranked #2 fastest-growing midsize company by OC Business Journal with 650% revenue growth.

Co-founded Good Funding in 2020 with Ben Gold. Previously VP of Strategic Partnerships at National Funding (2018-2020), VP of Sales at Quick Bridge Funding (2011-2018), and Director of Sales at Five Point Capital (2003-2010). University of Maryland Robert H. Smith School of Business, BS in Finance (1996-2000). Based in Tustin, California.
hooks: *17+ years in alt lending (Five Point to Good Funding)

news.h: Good Funding Closes Up to $30M Credit Facility
news.d: Good Funding closed $20M senior revolving credit facility with accordion to $30M, marking its inaugural institutional financing. Brean Capital served as exclusive advisor.

leaders.bg: 25+ years building and managing profitable equipment finance companies. Previously at M&C Leasing, Evans Bank, and Blue Bridge Financial. Expert in portfolio management and risk modeling. Under his leadership, Targeted Lending expanded its Wells Fargo credit facility to $75M in April 2025, and then to $125M in January 2026. Specializes in small-ticket equipment loans up to $250K, capitalizing on market gaps in strategic funding.

news.h: Targeted Lending Expands Wells Fargo Credit Facility to $125 Million
news.d: Targeted Lending expanded its senior credit facility with Wells Fargo Capital Finance to $125M, underscoring demand for its originator-centric equipment finance platform.

news.h: Targeted Lending Expands Wells Fargo Credit Facility to $75 Million
news.d: Targeted Lending expanded its senior credit facility from initial level to $75M with Wells Fargo Capital Finance.

leaders.bg: Led Advantage Merchant Funding as CEO from February 2017 through approximately March 2025. Manhattan-based fintech providing MCA and customized business funding solutions. Monique Chance serves as COO. Company provides fast approvals with no credit score minimums including subprime and no-credit-check MCA options. Limited additional public information available on personal background.

Co-founded Aztec Financial in 1997 with the Hanks brothers (owners of Bridgewater Companies). Served as CFO and led the company as President through growth as a leading equipment finance provider for specialty contractors in cleaning, restoration, and surface preparation industries. In 2021, Aramsco sold 100% of stock of Aztec's parent to North Mill Equipment Finance and Taycor Financial. North Mill assumed the existing portfolio while Taycor assumed vendor relationships and origination capabilities.

news.h: North Mill Equipment Finance and Taycor Financial Acquire Aztec Financial
news.d: Aramsco sold Aztec Financial to North Mill and Taycor. North Mill assumed the portfolio, Taycor took vendor relationships and origination in the restoration and cleaning industries.

leaders.bg: 30 years in manufacturing of machined parts before transitioning to financial services. Former Loan Officer at GMAC ResCap. Previously at Vintage Financial Group. Based in Hollister, California. Blue Line Capital Group operates mortgage origination in CA, OR, MT, ID, and CO, plus a separate NYC-based entity providing small business loans and lines of credit. BBB-accredited.

Founded Centra Funding in 2006 in Plano, TX. 29+ years in the leasing industry. Also President of 4 Hour Funding. Member of AACFB Industry Advisory Council 2024-2025. Centra is a subsidiary of CV Holdings, Inc. In 2024, acquired LeaseQ's Restaurant and Franchise Team from TimePayment Corp, launching Centra Culinary Finance brand. Previously closed a $69M securitization (2021) and received $10M equity infusion from CV Holdings (2020). Raised $5.2M in May 2025.

news.h: Centra Funding Acquires LeaseQ Restaurant and Franchise Team
news.d: Centra acquired LeaseQ's restaurant and franchise platform from TimePayment Corp, launching the Centra Culinary Finance brand under experienced foodservice team leadership.

news.h: Centra Funding Closes $69 Million Securitization
news.d: Centra completed its first securitization of equipment finance receivables, with Wells Fargo Securities as structuring and placement agent.

leaders.bg: Managing Member of Funderial (formerly Imperial Advance) since 2010, based in Midtown Manhattan. Pace University graduate with Bachelor's degree. Oversees strategic direction and day-to-day operations. Funderial was founded in 2010 and connects businesses with 160+ lending partners for MCAs, loans, lines of credit, and equipment financing. Minimum credit score of 500 with startups qualifying at 2 months in business.

Senior executive at Funderial overseeing business development and lending partner relationships. Part of leadership team alongside Oleg Rud. Limited additional public information available on personal background.

Co-founded GoKapital in 2013 with brother Oliver Moreno in Miami to address capital access gaps for small businesses. Previous experience at BlackRock, Finacity Corporation, and US Department of Labor. Named National Financial Services CEO of the Year 2023. GoKapital recognized as one of 7 Best Business Loan Brokers for 2024 by Fit Small Business. Claims a 95% business loan approval rate. Based at 3191 Coral Way, Miami.

news.h: GoKapital Named One of 7 Best Business Loan Brokers 2024
news.d: GoKapital recognized alongside top business loan brokers for its diverse range of small business loan products and high approval rates.

leaders.bg: Co-founded InterNex Capital in 2015. Former VP and Head of Global Corporate Receivables Programs at ICE (Intercontinental Exchange). Former CEO of Working Capital Solutions at GE Capital. Led InterNex past $2B in total SMB funding using proprietary Velocity platform. Reduced average loan-origination cycle times by 40%, from application to funding in just 5 days. Over one-third of InterNex funding goes to women- and minority-owned businesses. Partnered with Genpact for cloud-based operations.

news.h: InterNex Capital Surpasses $2 Billion in SMB Funding
news.d: InterNex reached $2B milestone in total funding for small and mid-sized businesses, with one-third of funding supporting women- and minority-owned businesses.

news.h: 400 Capital Management and InterNex Capital Partner for $100M SMB Funding
news.d: 400 Capital Management partnered with InterNex to provide $100M in funding to small and mid-sized businesses through InterNex's digital lending platform.

leaders.bg: Founded Lendinero in 2014 to address capital access gaps for Latino-owned businesses. Career started in financial services in 1996 at John Hancock Financial Services. Bachelor's degree and post-graduate studies from Florida International University and Florida State University. Completed executive education with distinction from Harvard Business School. Grew revenues 400%+ and net revenues 900%+. Over $10M delivered to small businesses, 80%+ Latino-owned. Featured in Forbes, Entrepreneur, and deBanked. Resides in Miami and Central America.

CEO of Mr Advance based in Astoria, NYC. Note: ZoomInfo lists Avi Kay as CEO, suggesting possible name variation or leadership change. Former roles at Citi Capital LLC and Yellowstone Capital (A Fundry Brand). Company is a direct lender using fintech for alternative business lending, offering MCAs, SBA loans, lines of credit, invoice factoring, and collateralized loans with funding up to $1.5M and same-day approvals.

Former co-founder of Par Funding (Complete Business Solutions Group). Sentenced on March 26, 2025 to 186 months (15.5 years) in prison by Judge Mark A. Kearney for operating a fraudulent investment vehicle. Pled guilty in September 2024 to RICO conspiracy, securities fraud, tax crimes, and perjury. Ordered to forfeit a private jet and $20M investment account, $120M forfeiture money judgment, $314M restitution, and $50,000 fine. Par Funding used threats of violence to collect from overdue MCA customers.

Former co-founder of Par Funding and wife of Joseph LaForte. LaForte used McElhone as his nominee to conceal his ownership and control of Par Funding. Claimed net worth of nearly $800M at one point. Pled guilty to wire fraud. Prosecutors recommended less than 2.5 years in prison. Receiver sold their Jupiter, FL home after RICO sentencing.
hooks: Jupiter FL home sold by receiver

news.h: Par Funding CEO Sentenced to 15.5 Years for RICO, Securities Fraud, Tax Crimes
news.d: Joseph LaForte sentenced to 186 months, ordered to forfeit $140M+ in assets and pay $314M restitution for operating the $500M fraudulent MCA investment scheme.

news.h: Wife of Par Funding Founder Pleads Guilty to Wire Fraud
news.d: Lisa McElhone pled guilty to wire fraud tied to hiding millions; prosecutors recommended under 2.5 years imprisonment.

news.h: Par Funding Defendants Settle with SEC, Will Repay $500M Fraud
news.d: Par Funding defendants reached settlement with SEC in connection with the $500M investment fraud scheme involving unregistered securities to finance high-fee merchant lending.

leaders.bg: Founded TMC Community Capital in 2018 and TMC Financing in 1981. TMC Financing is now the largest CDC in the nation for SBA 504 loans. Bay Area business and civic leader with 40+ years in small business lending. TMC Community Capital has disbursed $9M+ to approximately 350 businesses, with 82% going to entrepreneurs of color. Remains part-time CEO and continues as President/CEO of TMC Financing.

First full-time CEO of TMC Community Capital. Born in East San Jose. Former small business banker at Chase Bank, where he created a partnership with nonprofit microlender Opportunity Fund to refer applicants who didn't qualify for traditional loans. Former VP of community development at USC Credit Union focusing on South Central LA. Previously at Mocafi (now Mobility Capital Finance) fintech. Opened new downtown San Jose office in 2024.

news.h: First Foundation Bank Awards $100K Grant to TMC Community Capital
news.d: First Foundation Bank partnered with Federal Home Loan Bank of San Francisco to award $100K grant supporting TMC CC's 'Racially Just Community-Based Underwriting' program.

news.h: TMC Community Capital Opens Downtown San Jose Office
news.d: TMC CC opened in downtown San Jose to offer low-cost microloans to women, minority, and low-income entrepreneurs.

leaders.bg: Founded Wall Street Funding in 2010 as one of the nation's fastest-growing small business lenders. In the alternative funding/MCA/B2B space since 2006. In 2017, couldn't find a robust lending platform so built Onyx IQ, a full-service technology platform built by lenders for lenders. Onyx IQ partners with ACHWorks and Actum Processing to power alternative lending operations. Also co-founder of Big Think Capital. Wall Street Funding is A+ BBB rated with 10,000+ businesses funded.

news.h: Onyx IQ Debuts End-to-End Alternative Lending Platform
news.d: Jay Keller's Onyx IQ launched its full-service lending platform built by lenders for lenders, addressing gaps in MCA technology infrastructure.

news.h: ACHWorks and Onyx IQ Partner to Power Simply Funding
news.d: Onyx IQ and ACHWorks partnered to deliver integrated payment processing for alternative lending operations.

leaders.bg: Founded LiftForward in 2013, building an embedded lending fintech platform operating in 15+ countries. Over 25 years of executive management experience in finance and fintech. Landed Microsoft as a client in 2013 to power Surface Membership (monthly equipment-as-a-service bundles). Also partnered with MasterCard. Developed one of the largest integrated networks of major OEMs, retailers, and banks globally. Featured on Fintech One-on-One podcast and Future Nexus discussing embedded lending.

news.h: LiftForward Highlighted in BNPL Market Analysis
news.d: LiftForward recognized as key player shaping the future of embedded finance and Buy Now, Pay Later solutions for brands, merchants, and banks.

leaders.bg: CEO and co-founder of Regium Funding, founded in 2020 in Fort Lauderdale (110 East Broward Boulevard). Baruch College BBA in Marketing. Grew Regium to approximately $500M revenue in 2024 with 150% YoY growth, building to $1B cumulative sales by 2025. Company provides MCA, royalty-based investments, and purchase of future receivables with a flexible fee structure starting at 1% per week. A+ BBB rated.

Co-founded Enigma Technologies in 2012 and served as CEO, building a data science company in the aftermath of the financial crisis. Columbia University graduate. Co-founded Prime Financial Technologies in 2022 as an Enigma spin-off to address lending service gaps for community banks. Raised $53M initial funding from NEA, Third Point, Capital One Ventures, Customers Bank, and Enigma. Prime builds software for small banks to manage the lifecycle of SMB loans. Company grew from 1-10 to 11-50 employees by 2025.

news.h: Customers Bank Teams with Fintech on Small-Business Loan Software
news.d: Customers Bank partnered with Prime Financial Technologies, a fintech spin-off from Enigma, to power small business lending using its embedded lending platform.

leaders.bg: Started career as attorney, transitioned to mortgage banking then financial sales before founding Big Think Capital in Melville, NY. Company ranked #19 on Fortune's Best Small Workplaces 2025 and #30 on Fortune's Best Small/Medium Workplaces in Financial Services 2025. Appointed Ami Dviri (ex-JP Morgan Chase, Deutsche Bank, New York Life) as CMO in March 2024. Big Think Capital is A+ BBB rated with 2,000+ five-star Trustpilot reviews and 98% positive rating. 112 employees.

news.h: Big Think Capital Ranked #19 Fortune Best Small Workplaces 2025
news.d: Big Think Capital recognized as one of the best small workplaces in the US, also ranking #30 in Financial Services & Insurance.

news.h: Big Think Capital Appoints Ami Dviri as Chief Marketing Officer
news.d: Ami Dviri joined Big Think Capital as CMO with 20 years of experience at Fortune 100 companies including JP Morgan Chase, Deutsche Bank, and New York Life.

name: CLARIFY CAPITAL II LLC d/b/a Clarify Capital

leaders.bg: Co-founded Clarify Capital in 2017 with Bryan Gerson. Based on Madison Avenue in Manhattan. Leads a boutique lending firm working with 75+ lenders to secure competitive funding for SMBs nationwide with a 24-hour turnaround process. Clarify Capital reported approximately $2M in annual revenue. Limited additional public background information available.

Co-founded Clarify Capital in 2017 with Michael Baynes. Leads research initiatives including the 2025 SMB Recession Readiness Report surveying 300 entrepreneurs. Also publishes a county index of small business growth. Based in New York City. Limited additional public background information available.

news.h: Clarify Capital Publishes 2025 SMB Recession Readiness Report
news.d: Bryan Gerson led survey of 300 entrepreneurs to assess small business recession preparedness, positioning Clarify Capital as an SMB research thought leader.
